title: Manchester United news: Rio Ferdinand picks Daniel James as best player but slams squad depth
text:
Daniel James has been identified as Manchester United's standout player this season by the club's former defender Rio Ferdinand.

With three goals in 10 games so far, James has been the brightest light in a difficult start to the season that sees Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's men sit 12th after eight games.

However, Ferdinand believes the Welsh winger's prominence betrays the lack of attacking options in the squad after both Romelu Lukaku and Alexis Sanchez were allowed to leave for Inter Milan.

Daniel James has enjoyed an impressive start to his Manchester United career with three goals

Ferdinand told talkSPORT. 'I don't think they [United] expected what they have got from Daniel James so early on in his Manchester United career,'

'He's probably been their most influential player so far, so what does that really say about that squad?

'You're buying someone from Swansea who was probably brought in as someone who is going to flourish at a later date.

'However, he's been forced to the forefront as their main man in the team at the moment. That really says where Manchester United are at this minute in time.'
description: Daniel James has been identified as Manchester United's standout player this season by the club's former defender Rio Ferdinand.
